identificationModule.briefTitle: Relation Between Dose and Time to Reinjection of Botulinum Toxin-A in Patient With Poststroke Spasticity From a Real-world Healthcare Insurance Database.
identificationModule.officialTitle: Relation Between Dose and Time to Reinjection of Botulinum Toxin-A in Patient With Poststroke Spasticity From a Real-world Healthcare Insurance Database.

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Determining the mean/median time between botulinum toxin-A injection within the treatment of patients with spasticity after stroke in relation to the botulinum toxin dose from a healthcare insurance database in the Netherlands.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Mean time to next injection per brand
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From baseline up to end of data collection (January 2012 up to December 2016)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Median time to next injection per brand
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From baseline up to end of data collection (January 2012 up to December 2016)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Dosing of botulinum toxin-A in daily practice in relation to time to next injection
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From baseline up to end of data collection (January 2012 up to December 2016)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Average cost per year per brand per patient
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From baseline up to end of data collection (January 2012 up to December 2016)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Exploring factors like age, gender, time since diagnosis stroke that influence dosing and time between botulinum toxin-A treatments
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From baseline up to end of data collection (January 2012 up to December 2016)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Time interval between 2 injections of the same brand
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From baseline up to end of data collection (January 2012 up to December 2016)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* A patient will be included if he has a diagnosis stroke within the rehabilitation setting and has received at least two injections of botulinum toxin-A: Dysport or Botox

Exclusion Criteria:

* A patient will be excluded if he has been only treated with Xeomin
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: All patients selected from the database claimed within the code 313 will be included in the descriptive analyses.
